result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devario Sincere Cruz

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Devario Sincere Cruz in court.  Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court for Devario Sincere Cruz.  Attorney Samuel Tufford in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Case calendared for Final Pretrial.  State filed other acts motion.  Defense requests time to review and requests a motion hearing date.  Court grants request and orders jury trial vacated.  Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 34, Judge Yamahiro in Room 423 of the Safety Building.
Motion hearing scheduled for January 24, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for February 13, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Witness List received and filed.  bm
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  bm
State's Motion to Admit Panorama or Other Acts of Evidence received and filed.  bm
State's Motion in Limine received and filed.  bm
State's Witness List received and filed.  bm

State's Notice of Intent to use a Child's Audiovisual Recorded Statement (AVRS) at Trial and Request for a Pretrial Hearing on Admissibility, Pursuant to Wis. Stats. Section 908.08(2) and (3) received and filed.  bm
Notice of Expert Testimony received and filed.  bm
Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing (12 pages) commencing 04-05-2022 by Pauline Garry.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with H.M.R. and M.M.M.

Defendant Devario Sincere Cruz in court with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Erin Michelle Karshen for Samuel Tufford appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for Scheduling Conference.  State has turned over Discovery.  Defense requested Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates.  Court Order defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision, with no electronic monitoring.  Any Motion to be filed by September 1, 2022.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Devario Sincere Cruz in court with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Kathryn Ginsberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: nk
Case in Court for Scheduling Conference.  Defense waiting for Discovery.  Defense requesting more time to review case.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Devario Sincere Cruz in court with Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer L. Bray. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 12.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel received and filed.  bm

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with H.M.R., M.M.M. and the house located at 409 W Washington Street, Milwaukee WI.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Devario Sincere Cruz in court with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Devario Sincere Cruz not in court.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/8/22 @ 1p
